Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, perfect for my needs”
Reviews.Author: teedle57
Reviews.Content: I am a 50-something woman who was looking for a place to sleep for three nights close to my daughter's small Manhattan apartment. I reserved a twin room with shared bath and requested a mature roommate, but was pleasantly surprised when I was upgraded to a private double room which looked like it had been recently upgraded. I had figured I could use my daughter's shower if the shared bath was a problem, but the bathroom across the hall from my room was clean and there was plenty of hot water. Front desk staff was efficient and responsive, and the door men were very helpful and friendly. While I didn't make use of the communal areas, there seemed to be plenty of people hanging out watching movies and using their laptops. With it's fabulous location at 103rd/Broadway, this reasonably priced hostel was everything I hoped for and more.

Reviews.Title: “New York In November”
Reviews.Author: canadianlady1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 9am after a red eye flight we were pleasantly greeted by front desk staff checked in, and were given our keys to our room after placing a small deposit for key return. The room is basic but had our own bathroom and the room had flat screen tv and clean towels. The location is amazing, and the hotel staff were best part of the trip. Thanks Maggie and Yarilee for giving great service and recommendations for New York City, they were really helpful and went out of there way to accommodate us when we needed extra items like new towels and extra blankets. I would recommend Broadway Hotel for its service and price.

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible exp!”
Reviews.Author: Yy4567
Reviews.Content: I booked one bed here but when I reached here on 25th night I saw there is a notice to vacate at the front and do not enter notice. when I called them, they told a couple of rooms are not in good shape. What a Sham!

Reviews.Title: “A very good Hostel and Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elenafratt88
Reviews.Content: Very well its position ( two blocks far away from 103 st. /subway n.1 ), there's a supermarket 4 blocks later! The reception is kind and very well great to advise customers!! Always open! Rooms and bathrooms perfectly cleaned everyday!! Price? Not so cheap but no so expensive because its in NY! I really advise this accomodation to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not very hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend found this hostel to be great if you want to keep yourself to yourself. The major positive was the location, it was two blocks from a metro station which ran to most of the major sites, A few of the negatives were the staff behind the desk, one in particulr was the person who checked us in. He was very rude and abrupt and it felt like he was annoyed with us for making him work and check us in. When he gave us the key we opened the door to our private room to find somebody sat on the bed. We went back down and expained the situation and he did provide us with an alternative room straight away however the manor and customer service was somewhat nonexistent. My overall opionion on this place was simply OK. Probably better deals out there with better value for money. I would look elsewhere if I were to go back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for basic hostel with some perks.”
Reviews.Author: SavvyFaire
Reviews.Content: This is a decent, well-managed and brilliantly located hostel in NYC. The rooms are what you'd expect - very basic, with a set of bunk beds, lockers and a sink. Beds were comfortable enough. Bathrooms on the hall were satisfactory and while not pristine, fairly clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. What makes this a cut above some other hostels is the huge lounge area - with 3 flat screen TVs, comfy couches and a kitchen/food prep area with counter and tables. I nice place to hang out and read, chat, surf the web (free WiFi) or have a meal. (There are computers available, but the price is ridiculously high.) Two blocks from the subway and lots of restaurants nearby. For the price ($35 for a bunk in a double room) it can't be beat. There was one real con - the rooms have nothing besides the bed - no hooks, no chair or bench (ever try to put on shoes and socks standing up?) Putting a couple of folding chairs and a few hooks on the walls would not cost the hostel much and go a LONG way to making this place a 5-star NYC hostel. One note...on the 3rd floor, there is a "permanent resident" who leaves his door open and is not all that quiet...and his room smells of food and smoke. This is something that should be addressed - perhaps a discount for people staying in his immediate vicinity. It was decidedly off-putting.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: s_mazzone1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights starting Jan 24. Shared bathrooms were kept nice and clean, and there are only about three rooms to one shower, so I never encountered any queues. Room was very comfortable, and standalone sink was handy, however the heating was turned up a bit far, perhaps. As two young females traveling alone, we felt very safe in the neighborhood, even late at night. Very close to the 1, 2, and 3 trains. The reception staff were SO friendly and helpful, even when overrun with people crowding the lobby whilst checking in. I definitely recommend this hostel and will stay here again when in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Annie C
Reviews.Content: Good price for New york. The room was basic but the lounge and kitchen are nice. Easy to meet people. Good location. Nice walk into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: pepoling
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here in December when we came down from CT for an opera. It is much better than your typical hostel (and I've hostelled all over Europe) and is more like the type of budget hotel I typically stay at in Europe but hardly exists here in the US. Our room was very simple, but we were happy to have 2 beds, a TV, shelves, towels, a sink, and shampoo! Again, most hostels do NOT offer these things. The room was toasty warm. An old-style elevator is cool but there is no reason not to use the stairs, it is good exercise. The reception was EXTREMELY friendly and it's great to have a fridge to store food in. We didn't see anyone else using the bathroom on our floor and it was perfectly clean and spacious. The negative review here is clearly from someone who lacks experience staying in hostels. This one is above average.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in NY for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: This hotel/hostel was great for the price. This was my first time in New York and in a hostel, so I really didn't know what to expect. I booked a private room with a private bathroom for about $120 a night. The room and bathroom were both perfectly clean and comfortable. Plenty enough room for two people in the queen bed. There was a lounge area that was nice, and the staff were very helpful. Short walk to both subway and bus. Would definitely stay here again- awesome price and cool location in New York!

Reviews.Title: “hostel? more like dog house”
Reviews.Author: courtney b
Reviews.Content: never in my whole life have i stayed in a place as bad and as un-welcoming, what we got there with friends i cried my eyes out for hours wanting to be home again! it was dirty and no clean towels were given to us at all for 5 days, we had to ask for them. also we shared a bath room with the whole floor which was 6 people and is was dirty and hairy and never cleaned! i went in my friends instead, which was in fact several floors above me, there was people all over the place when i got out i felt crap walking past them!and was always frezing cold where it took you breath away, dont ever get me started on my room?-.- no drawers or wardrobe to hang my cloths in and there was a small mirrow and in my room i didn't even have a sink for crying out loud! the bathroom was oppisit however all bloody night we heard the chain getting flushed and people talking in the bathroom and people had music on early in the morning and late at night? the lift was pathetic and we got wrong fro using it when we were told that we could walk? i had to drag my case up 6 flights of stares. also in our room it was freezing on night and the next red hot? make you mind up? i had to open the window in our room and the fan wasen't working and we couldn't open the ones in the lobbey or we were told to close them? one of my friends room smelt like cheese that was because she was above the kitchen or something and all she could smell was food and her clothes were stinking form it! the hotel staff were all a different laungage and sorry but i couldn't understand what they were saying and they seemed very ignorant! (part from the man what kept the front door open he was really helpfull with everything):) or and yes, how could i forget there was animals kept 2 rooms from me a sandy coloured dog a parrot and a kitten? they were left to room around out hotel i saw the dog a lot and the parrot never shut up!-.- it stunk the place out! seriously is this a hotel/hostel or zoo? p.s. i would recommend this hotel for dogs that have no place to go!!!! what a utter garbadge, never again....

Reviews.Title: “Hostel?! I've stayed in worse hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: Katie H
Reviews.Content: After spending several days researching for a decent-quality hostel at a good price, I settled on Broadway Hotel and Hostel. As soon as I arrived at the location, my gut told me I had made the right choice. Firstly, the location of the hostel is simply excellent. A bus-ride from the airport dropped me off just four blocks away. A five minute walk later and I was standing at the front door. From the outside, the place oozes 'hotel' and comes complete with a concierge to open the door and kindly lift your baggage up the 3 steps. The ground floor consists of a check-in desk and lounge-area for residents. The staff at the check-in desk got me settled immediately and after paying a $5 returnable deposit for a room key, I was on my way. Being told my room was on the 2nd floor, I took the lift. BIG mistake. I would advise anyone never to take the lift, unless you have time to kill :-) Once on the 2nd floor, I saw three bathrooms (all EXCELLENTLY maintained and furnished... including a lovely clean smell which is always present due to the constant cleaning) and a small number of rooms. The room I stayed in was secure, clean, and nicely furnished - including a flat screen LCD TV on the wall. The bed was adequate for a hostel and the temperature was fine (especially considering I generally run cold and this was early December). Throughout my stay, the staff were available to give handy tourist tips (often saving me $$!) and were always friendly. The lounge area consists of several comfortable sofas and chairs, two large wall-mounted TVs, and a great sound system. A kitchen area is also available for guests to rustle up snacks or dinner. All-in-all, the 'hostel' was excellent and I have certainly stayed in worse hotels. I would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Simply great”
Reviews.Author: Reclusive
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights following a business trip elsewhere in the states. The hostel was easy to find, handily positioned near a metro stop and in a nice area. The hostel itself was great. It is clearly newly refurbished and the amenities downstairs were top draw for a hostel. The room was nice, clean and well appointed with a sink, flat screen TV and an iPod dock (assuming unlike me you have one). The beds were comfy if a little creaky! But I had a great nights sleep both nights. The bathrooms were out in the hall, but kept very clean all day. I loved the place and hope to be back at some time in the future hopefully!

Reviews.Title: “Double booked on first night of stay”
Reviews.Author: maddy_j_11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the 2nd Oct 2011 for a stay on the 10th Dec 2011 for 4 nights. We arrived at the hotel in the evening after a long day of travelling, only to be told that they were fully booked for the first night. They offered for us stay the first night at one of their sister hotels then come back to the hotel for the following 3 nights. I told them we were not prepared to spend the little time that we had in NYC, moving from one hotel to another. They eventually found a room at their sister hotel for the whole stay. Cannot run a knees up in a brewery springs to mind!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for hostel room”
Reviews.Author: beruangteddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a hostel room shared with another person. I just needed a room to sleep in as I was going to be out the whole day. The bedroom was pretty clean. The bathroom was very clean and maintained clean. So that is great. The staff were friendly and nice and quite helpful. I am very glad that they took note of my request. I booked a mixed dorm hostel room but I requested for a female roommate and they placed me with one. :) It is just too bad the internet was only in the common room and the internet was very slow. But overall it was a great value for a clean place.

Reviews.Title: “Works for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nutmeg_Cinnamon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hostel portion of this place in a two bed per room reservation. The room was dark and somewhat cold with a sink and a locker. There are bathrooms down the hall which for me were always clean and open 95% of the time. The staff were all very nice, friendly and helpful. I was cold and kept asking for more blankets, and they gladly gave me as many as I needed. They were not able to control the heat though, so even though the room was chilly, they could not improve it. We had a snowstorm one day, and even then the heaters did not kick into a higher heat, but at least we had power. I heard all of the East coast lost power and thousands were without ANY heat, so I was grateful to have any heat and my six blankets. :-) I also like to be very warm when I sleep, so that's just me. The kitchen area has a microwave and sink, but no pots, pans, utensils, cups, etc. It's better for making simple things or heating up leftovers. There is a "bar" which serves breakfast and snacks throughout the day which I found helpful. The elevator is small and slow, so after you take the trip with your luggage, unless you are way high up or have an injury, it's probably better to take the stairs. The lounge area downstairs is cozy and great. Lots of seating, it's decorated and designed nicely, there are books for trade or borrowing, internet, three plasma TVs which play news in the morning and movies at night. Overall I was content with the hostel. I paid more than I thought it should be, but hostels and hotels were very pricey this fall (2011), so compared to the other prices, it was decent. I would like to see better lighting in the room, and in the halls, but in general it was safe, clean and fine. It's close to the train and many delicious, affordable restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience for an awesome price.”
Reviews.Author: gypsieblood
Reviews.Content: Just right for our needs. We only wanted a good nights sleep and a clean place to get ready each morning. The location was perfect for getting to the subway blocks away. We felt safe and the neighborhood was friendly and relaxed. The staff of young people were very warm and polite. We enjoyed interacting with the young travelers from Europe. I definitely recommend staying as long as its understood this is a practical hotel for a low cost. Its not extravagant but that is what the city is for. :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel in Manhatten New York - clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: mondayclub
Reviews.Content: Did'nt expect much for the price but very impressed. Located in Upper West side just off Broadway - very easy to catch the Subway - generally nice and quite area with great food.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far but nice quiet area”
Reviews.Author: eurkd82
Reviews.Content: This place was farther away from things than we thought. Way up on the upper west side. Howvwer it is only a couple of short blocks from the subway. The area is nice and quiet. Reaidential. We came home around 3 am one night and the walk from the subway to the hostel seemed safe. The rooms have a bunk bed, lockers and a sink. It was nice for two of us as it was like having a private room. The bathrooms are shared. I did wish the rooms had a table or a chair. There's plety of room. The rooms were clean and the shared bathrooms were sometimes clean. My big complaint is that they clean the bathrooms at 7 or 8 in the morning and its loud. I wasn't in new york to sleep but it still wouldve been nice if they waited until later. Its unlikely that the elevator will be working but they have a doorman/porter/huge flirt who will take your luggage up for you. The staff was friendly and when our airport shuttle came late they were helpful in finding us an alternative ride so we didn't miss out flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and clean”
Reviews.Author: charlichou
Reviews.Content: I'm really pleased with this hotel. The room was nice, clean, the bed was soft. The staff was really nice. A good atmospere. It's really closed to the subbway so it's easy and fast to go downtown. The only thing that was missing was the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - But a complete rip off”
Reviews.Author: Orlagh M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hostel for one night in early September and, while the staff are very friendly and the place does have a good 'youth hostel' kind of atmosphere, it is definitely not worth what you pay! Granted I was booking very last minute, I paid 70 dollars for a bed in a two-bed dorm. There was no internet in the bedrooms and the rooms were the most basic I have come across. I was very unhappy with having to fork out that much for so little, however unfortunately I was desperate. In addition, they made a huge mistake by giving me a key to a room that was already occupied. So after lugging my case upstairs and opening the bedroom door, I walked into a room with 3 very confused looking guys still in bed - poor show! Also, I may have been more comfortable spending this much if the hostel had a very central location, but it does not. While the subway is just right beside it, it isn't exactly within walking distance of most of New York's attractions. As a comparison, I had previously stayed 2 nights at the Morningside Inn (6 blocks away) and paid 23 dollars a night for 3 bed room with a tv and fridge- a big, big difference.

Reviews.Title: “our broadway stay”
Reviews.Author: Nat_tik83
Reviews.Content: What we needed - a room for 2 nights stay, close to center and metro, soft bed and cheap accommodation in New York. And we got it! Very nice staff who kept a big box for us for a week. Helpful. Internet was only downstairs and very slow. The common WC was clean and free all the time (don't know why) =)

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: JalaBoston
Reviews.Content: For a budget youth hostel it's probably fine. I haven't seen the dorm rooms so I can't say for sure. I stayed in a double bed private room with bathroom, and it was disappointing & so far from the description on the website. At $200 a night, it is a complete rip-off. I chose it because it was near to the meetings I needed to go to in Morningside, but I should have simply commuted from a different hotel (I've stayed at one in hell's kitchen, the french quarters, which is way better and the same price!). Room was ok in both cleanliness and size, but no place to hang clothes, hallway has an odd smell, bathroom floor was sticky, carpet dingy, A/C quite loud, no radio, phone, or iron in the room.

Reviews.Title: “never again!”
Reviews.Author: IBZeUncle
Reviews.Content: Room was too small, squalid and dirty, the bed and the bathroom door were broken. It was noisy all the time and the air conditioner seemed to explode. The service was not the best and the staff not friendly and we paid about 200 dollars per night, what an impudence!

Reviews.Title: “BROADWAY Hotel owes a school group a REFUND of more than $5 000 after cancelling their FULLY paid accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Tesmith
Reviews.Content: JUST TO WARN THE READERS THAT WE NEVER HAD THE OPPORTUNITY TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL... pls read the reason as described below: In the 1st week of May my school group's accommodation payment was due to the hotel. The payment was promptly made by wire transfer. On the 28th May the hotel emailed me with the news that the hotel was closed down by the Dept of Building and that the money paid - more than $5 000 for a group of 46 people for 3 nights - would be FULLY refunded shortly. I had to find accommodation for my group of 46 people at this short notice, since we were due to arrive in NYC on 26 June 2011 - paying another $6 000+ for the substitute accommodation, depleting this school trip's accommodation budget completely and pushing iot into the RED! We have returned from our trip to the USA yesterday, and have STILL not been refunded our $5 000+ that Broadway Hotel is owing to us. There is in fact NO word from them regarding this issue. When I try to communicate with group sales dept, they are completely unco-operative to any sort of urgent appeal regarding this refund which is FULLY due to this school group. WHAT more can i say than that I have NEVER before been treated in this manner - absolutely CRIMINAL! I would appreciate ANY advice anybody has to offer on how to persue this matter further.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in safe enviroment.”
Reviews.Author: Sylvie035
Reviews.Content: We arrived with 11 students ranging from 14-16 yrs, in the morning. We could not check in yet but the Hostel stored our luggage for us until we could. They were also helpful with re-arranging our sleeping accommodations as we had an uneven number of boys in our school group. As it was only myself and another female colleague looking after the students we were concerned with security but in our 10 day stay, not once did we feel threatened or vaguely uncomfortable. For the money that you pay, it is an excellent establishment. Clean, funky and full of young guests from across the world. We had to share bathrooms with other travellers but the staff kept it clean and hygienic for the next users. Try and get a room as high up as possible due to street noise. There was an ATM machine in the lobby and numerous computers for you to use for a small charge. Very close to subway and busses pass by in Broadway. We used the subway till late at night as we went to the theatres most evenings. There are various cheap eateries within walking distance as well as numerous cell phone shops. Up a few blocks is Wholefoods store where you can get fresh salads, fruit and just about anything else if you start to get tired of fast food. Do try the Mexican restaurant just up the block around 103 Broadway, lovely ambience and good food. They have a mariachi band that plays most nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a budget”
Reviews.Author: loki_niflheim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a block walk away from no. 1 subway line and fairly easy to find. Front desk and doorman were friendly and quite helpful at check-in and throughout our stay. Unfortunately we shared the floor with hostel rooms packed full of rowdy French travelers who partied till 3-4am. Facilities are scarce and mostly not cleaned well, but our room is clean and comfortable (after worrying about bed bugs the whole trip, this was a relief), although the central heating can be overwhelming at times.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Grimace87
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the top floor private room hotel with private bathroom Pros: - very convenient location, just off broadway and near subway station - took us 10-15 mins to get to time square - clean and comfortable, they had clear bathrooms and frosted glass toilets which made the room appear bigger - cheap - we paid less than $100 a night - It's the upper west side but the area felt safe, especially because your just off a main street (Broadway) Cons: (not much) - the lift was broken so we had to walk the 7 (i think) flights for our trip, the elevator is also VERY slow I would DEFINITELY recommend it as a great budget hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not good variant”
Reviews.Author: thatsME12
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in the USA and my first night in NY. The photos from the web site don't correspond to reality. At least dorm-rooms. The only one thing that I liked is a hall. I lived in a room with 4 beds and it was really terrible to discover that there is no air-conditioner and the only window is closed! It was so hot and wet weather in July, so, the fan didn't help at all. There is only 1 bathroom on the floor, but it is rather big and clean. There is free WI-FI in the hostel, but if u want to use hostel's PC, it won't be cheap for you. The location is not good too. But the metro station is near the hostel. I didn't like this hostel and I would never advise it to smb else. I suppose, there are a lot of more comfortable hostels in Manhatten!

Reviews.Title: “Great everything!”
Reviews.Author: isasguedes
Reviews.Content: I'm from Brazil and was going back home after a three months work experience program in western Maryland and went to NY get to know the city. This hostel was perfect, the bathrooms were cleaned all the time and the bedrooms were very good also. The towels were a bit old, but also cleaned and changed every day. The rooms are not so pretty but the three ones i visited were wide and clean. The living room at the 1st floor was nice and staff were always very helpful and friendly. I paid a very small amount of money for all that so I definitely recommend this hostel! ps.: My trip was actually on march 2010, but that option was not available...

Reviews.Title: “Very bad Hostel!”
Reviews.Author: tomaarau
Reviews.Content: After 2 days we had to leave the hostel because they have to do a renovation, but they didn`t say us anything in advance. the staff doesn`t helped us to find en other hostel. We also had no warm water! so wehn you won`t be sure to have a bed in NYC, take an other hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Good located, no frills”
Reviews.Author: Felixrs
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheap and well located hotel hotel in NY, and we found this one. It's just in the westside, a nice neighborhood near Broadway avenue and close to two tube stations. Lots of delis and shops around where to eat breakfast and dinner. The hotel was very simple though. We had a room for 4 people, consisting in two bunk beds and one small window. Shower was shared. One good point for the hotel was the free WIFI available almost in the whole hotel. No breakfast, no frills. I have to say that NY is quite expensive, so if you are looking for a hotel with a good standard you will have to spend quite much money (comparing to other locations in the USA). This hotel was rather one of the cheap ones on this zone. Downstairs there was a common place with computers for rent, and a TV where they were playing films.

Reviews.Title: “broad way-a dream hotel of dream city”
Reviews.Author: subhu
Reviews.Content: a very centrally located near metro rail way station beetween columbus circle and coloumbia university.you will appriciate its cleaness.the receptionist will help you to buy bus passand guide you for sight seeing.but the rooms are a bit expensive as i had to pay tax extra but it was worth.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dino87_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel/hostel is a great place to stay on the upper west side convenient for everything. bit of chaos at reception at all times but aint no thang. Dino Carlucci

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: Miranda2011
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 6 nights. To summarise: the location is fantastic with the subway only 2 blocks away. The room and bathrooms are cleaned every day. It has obviously just had a facelift which makes it look okay but then on a closer inspection it has been poorly finished. The big downside is that it has no kitchen facilities. We're not sure what makes it a hostel as it's more of a hotel. Also, I'm pretty sure I picked up bedbugs from here. We moved around a fair bit before getting to NYC but there's a definite possibility that I got them from here because of the timing. It's also pretty loud in the rooms so bring ear plugs! For the price and location I think it's good but cheap accommodation is always a risk!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, cheap and cheerful but very basic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: BillyYoungUK
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in New York so as you can imagine we spent most of our time out and about. The hotel was a great base. 10 mins walk from central park and a 20min subway ride to Time sq. Plenty of diners, cafes and coffee houses where you can get a great breakfast are on your doorstep. Our room was basic and bloody cold as the heating seemed to only work for a couple of hours a day. Cleaned every day, the bathroom was spotless and not a bed bug in sight. Would def stay again but only in the summer!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE....”
Reviews.Author: Travel-BugSRC33
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and the atmosphere at the hostel was very friendly and enjoyable. I felt safe at all times and the amenities were good. You get what you pay for at a hostel and although it was my first time I had a wonderful time. It was a good place to come back and relax although the beds...were not the greatest..but again you get what you pay for for. Would I got back...yes...but I would get an upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: Jeanfer9948
Reviews.Content: Very good place to stay on a budget no problems what so ever staff very nice no problems with booking or room you get to know people from different countries nice lounge to hang out and meet people . Definitly coming back soon

Reviews.Title: “Interesting experience...”
Reviews.Author: mattel87
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hostel for 6 nights over new years. Pros: Excellent location- 5 mins walk to subway, and Broadway is fantastic street to walk along. Room was cleaned everyday, fresh linen and towels which was an unexpected surprise being a hostel. Free wifi in lobby, even if it is a bit slow, at least you can check your emails. Cons: stayed in a 2 bed dorm. The room was a shoebox, couldn't swing a cat in it. No heater so it was freezing, slept in thermals. There were some permanent residents who were very loud and noisy. Someone on our floor did not know how to use a toilet properly.... it was absolutely disgusting. I refused to use that bathroom, there were other bathrooms but the hot water wasn't that great. If your going to stay here, book the private rooms. From the reviews they sound much nicer (and more hygienic). Its not the sort of place where you would want to lounge about in your room.... but then again why would you when your in NYC??

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: wmwsussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a private double room. Not bad size but very dark. Bathroom clean and towels changed regularly which didn't expect in a hostel. Was disappointed with the kitchenette - not what I expected. Am used to staying in hostels where I can prepare a drink and usually a meal too. This one had a fridge, empty cupboards and a microwave. No plates, cups, mugs, cutlery - nothing to even boil water. Staff were pleasant and friendly. Felt completely safe at night in the area. Very well situated for getting around the city by both subway and walking . Would stay there again because with NY prices it is still good value but would remember its not possible to self-cater

Reviews.Title: “The elevator was too small.”
Reviews.Author: mpmpmg
Reviews.Content: Good compared to its cheap price. Good location. Bathrooms clean. Elevator too small. Very narrow hallway. Spacious room for 2 bunk bed dorm.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough!”
Reviews.Author: KristieMc
Reviews.Content: After travelling from Australia to New York (ie after 24 hours of travelling!!!), we got a shuttle to the hotel - which was fine, but we were the last to be dropped off so from arriving into New York at 9pm, we didnt end up at our hotel until after midnight. Then to find a sign on the door of the Broadway Hotel and Hostel saying it was declared unfit and you should enter at your own risk, or something like that. Then the woman at the desk looked at her computer screen for about 10 to 15 mins looking confused and when I asked what the problem was she told us that for some reason we were not in the booking system! I was very fed up with this and showed her the proof that we were in fact booked in. She then said all they could do was to put us in a hotel down the street called the Marakesh Hotel as they were fully booked. Not something you want to hear after travelling over 24 hours and having no sleep. She confirmed that we were able to stay for the next 5 nights but just not the first night. So we had to drag our very heavy bags down the street to the other hotel only to find there was no lift and we were put on the 3rd floor (which was six flights of stairs!). The next 5 nights was spent back in the Broadway Hotel and when checking in (again) I mentioned the difficulty that the woman the night before had trying to find our booking, and the guy checking us in said, "oh she could find it, we had just overbooked!". So that tells me that she was lying to us the whole time. We were lucky to get a room with its own bathroom - very grateful for that, I could not have stood having to share a bathroom. The room was very small, very little room between the end of the bed and the wall, so had to squeeze past to get to the other side. I would never stay there again and unless you are used to Dorm style hotels or hostels, I would not recommend staying there. Positives about it was that it was close to the subway and Starbucks and Convenience store and some other eateries. Thats all.

Reviews.Title: “Below par, especially for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: shannatic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in December...location was okay, near 2 subway stops, however the building has a condemned sign on the door which we were told "means nothing" - but why would it be there then? Was a very off-putting first impression. My friend and I had a double bed private room and were surprised at how tiny the bed was, it barely held the 2 of us and as friends travelling together it was a bit awkward. VERY basic room and dank, unwelcoming hallways. Also there was a complete lack of activites planned meaning it was hard to interact with other hostel guests. The room cost us over $200 a night and I wish I'd paid for a proper hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmm not sure!”
Reviews.Author: LauraKGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Having read a mixture of reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. We had booked a double double with shared bathroom only to be told when arrived that there had been a double booking (even though I had confimred by booking a week before I went and was told everything was fine) and the room wasn't available and were offered three singles and that our room would be ready in two days, we we're just so excited to be in NYC that we said yes no probs, in hindsight, maybe wouldv'e stuck our ground a bit more. The room was basic however the landing had a strange smell and I wasn't impressed with the shared bathrooms (tissues with blood lying around, hair etc), the further away bathroon was a lot cleaner.. We had to actually check out on the second day, we were out early which was fine but came back about lunchtime to charge our camera's etc and were told our new room still wan't ready, huge inconvieniance considering we had paid for 5 nights straight and there shouldn't have been a gap, reception didn't seem to get this and weren't very helpful I have to say. When we finally got our room it was fine, if we had this room when we arrived there would have been no problem. Oh forgot to say the bath wasn't working in the new room so couldn't have a bath. As people have said great location, subway station 5 mins away and takes you right to Times Square. You do basically get what you pay for, I have never stayed in a hostel before so I wasn't really used to the whole bathroom sharing thing and tiny rooms but as I say you get what you pay for and for all the time we were in the room it didn't really affect my enjoyment of the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel at this price in New York City”
Reviews.Author: djorlando24
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other comparatively priced places in NYC (with a private room in each case) this place is the best I have had and will certainly come back at this price. Pros: - room was clean and heated, nicely renovated, private sink - shared bathrooms were clean!! Pleasant surprise. Close to the bedrooms. - no long walks , and one bathroom for every two rooms so no queues. - staff were very friendly and helpful. Always quick to respond to any concern - nice common area with microwaves and couches. Clean and pleasant. - working elevator service to all levels - short walk to 103rd St for 1 train or 96th for 2 express. Well connected Cons: - hot water boiler broke down one morning and I couldn't get a hot shower. But the staff were great and had it fixed that afternoon. Only happened once. - windows facing broadway means you get more night street noise in these rooms. There's a PD and FD a block away so some sirens at night. But hey it's New York so if that bothers you don't come here!! :) In summary; it was far cleaner, better appointed and pleasant than any other place I've been to at this price. Friendly staff makes a huge change too. Will come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: ngunit
Reviews.Content: First the good, it was a fine location near two good metro stops and good eating in Amsterdam Avenue. Safe and secure too, and the staff were generally competent and helpful if you asked them. Then the not so good...... Our room was a tiny cell with a bunk bed and no space to sneeze; that's okay because we knew that's what they advertise but it was dispiriting. the internet was laughably slow and only worked in the common room.... It was noisy to sleep at night with loud noise from the pipes and from other residents (we needed ear plugs in our private room). The main room had big comfy lounges, a shame they left the TVs blaring at 4 billion decibels at all hours, even at 8am when you were trying to eat breakfast the TV was blazing away with cartoons and medicare ads ( and no-one to watch them). We had to ask the staff on quite a few days to turn the TVs down (no skin off their nose since no-one was watching them so why didn't they proactively fix it?!) You basically have nowhere you can call anyone on skype as the TVs are SO LOUD!! Our biggest gripe was the bloody kitchen, they actually only have a kitchenette with no metal cutlery and no, absolutely NO drinking vessels!! Seriously we had to go and buy some plastic cups so we could have a drink!! You can't cook for yourself at this "hostel" and you can barely eat a fully prepared meal with their miserable selection of utensils. They could easily fix some of the things that annoyed us so much, but I doubt they will.

Reviews.Title: “Nice main area, awful room”
Reviews.Author: Teena83
Reviews.Content: The main area is great, it is very well kept and very comfortable, only the people are very unsocial, they are all with their notebooks and the enviroment is not great. I stayed there in a shared dorm, and the room was depressive. It was big enough but the walls were like half painted and it smelled like food all the time, and the view from the window was zero. At night, there is a man that coughs incredibly loud in another room ( i was told later that the guy lives there) and its hard to sleep. Julio, the security guard is the best! And the location is not great, but still good, there are many restaurants and stores nearby. I would go again, but to a different room (not shared).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but no heat, warning sign on the entrance with no true explanation”
Reviews.Author: RelaxedAdaptable1
Reviews.Content: Priceline has this place as a hotel, so when I booked it for the price and my confirmation stated I would be sharing a bathroom, I figured it was a Hostel. Never having stayed at a hostel before, I was not prepared for the sign on the door stating basically that the place had been deemed Perilous to Life. When I inquired about the sign, I was told it was because the fire department did not approve of 4 beds to a room and they had 7 rooms that were like that. I noticed that there were 9 rooms on that list, so I doubt they were being upfront about the sign. Making sure that my room was not on that list, I agreed to stay. The downsides: Called ahead to inquire about the parking and they told me that there was plenty of parking in front of the hotel, incorrect. One lock on the door. Woke up at 2 AM freezing, old fashioned BROKEN HEATER, packed on more clothes. Noisy with paper thin doors. The upsides: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Clean room, clean bathroom.sink in the room, LCD 42" flat screen in the room. If I could get a straight answer about the sign on the door, I would recommend this place in warmer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff..”
Reviews.Author: Columbustta
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to New York, a low-budget one, I picked Broadway Hotel and Hostel for its fantastic location: on the Broadway - 100th Street intersection, with Metro stations couple of blocks away. Thanks to its location, I could spend a great evening and late-night in the Times Square and return safely in the wee hours. The staff are young, friendly - and helpful, which saw me through the first night. Returning late, I found the mini air-conditioner fixed on the lone window not working. Leave aside sleep, I just couldn't breathe. I went down the stairs - the lift is moody -- determined to sleep the night in the lobby or the TV room. The young man at the counter gave me a private room, as a special case. Next morning, the air conditioning was set right and I moved back into my room with twin bunk beds and a washbasin. Nothing else. The bed is squeaky but the linen is clean and the softest I have known. The other great thing about this place is its energy, thanks to young tourists of all nationalities. The TV room is a good meeting place. The place has no coffee shop but just outside are plenty of eating options. Even after paying for the twin bunk beds, I found the rent fair for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & good location.”
Reviews.Author: Dingdup
Reviews.Content: We had booked a bunk bed but were upgraded to a very nice twin room, with fan, AC, TV and a sink. It was spotlessly clean and we got fresh towels every day. Bathrooms were outside the room but this was not a problem, and they were also clean. The lay-out and quality of each bathroom differs, but you are free to use whichever you want so you can pick your favourite, and during the 6 days we stayed, we never had to wait. Nights were rather quiet, far less noisy than I had expected - which is good. What did spoil my night's rest a little, was the stiff mattress. The location is quite convenient and the area feels safe at all times. It's basically on Broadway, there are loads of shops and restaurants within 5 mins walk, and it's only a few steps from the 103 subway station. All receptionists were friendly and helpful. I would reccommend this hotel/hostel, and stay here again. There is only 1 simple thing that could and should be improved: fit some hooks and shelves in rooms and bathrooms. Or place some chairs. All stuff (clothes, toilet bag, towels) had to be put on the floor, in the room there was not even a designated space to leave your coat - we just had to throw it in a corner. Same with wet towels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: kyliew52
Reviews.Content: Nearest subway is 103rd Street, but 96th is close too. Maybe a 10-15 minutes ride into Midtown, and trains are frequent. It was certainly the best location we could find for our budget - most of the places suggested to us weren't even in Manhattan! We stayed in a double room and it was perfectly clean; it appeats basic, but it had a TV, bathroom and bed, which is all we wanted. In the morning hot water could be limited, but was fine in the evenings. We found that if we waited 5 minutes between our showers, it was perfectly fine. The staff are friendly and helpful, and overall we were happy with the place. Have breakfast at the Metro Diner on corner of 100th and Broadway - the omelettes are a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Booked here but stayed down the road at the Marrakech”
Reviews.Author: mrsholmes2b
Reviews.Content: We arrived after our journey from London, and first time using the New York subway, to find 2 very official looking signs on the hotel doors. From a brief read, it said that the hotel had been shut down because it was considered unfit for humans...and tresspassers who enter the property would be arrested! SO we were pretty shocked, however, a man told us to go in, so we did. The receptionist informed us that we would not be staying there, but would stay at their "sister hotel" The Hotel Marrakech. I asked what it was all about and what she told us was that the local authorities had decided to shut down hostels in the New York area. So, the rooms where there arte more than one set of bunk beds, had been closed completely. (They hadn't even been allowed to take the beds apart and sleep 2 people.) Therefore, the people who should have all stayed in that room, were moved to 2 private rooms, thus leaving no private rooms for those who had booked those...so were moved to the Marrakech. (We were there from 16th-19th October 2010 and the new law had only just been passed. They need to apply to re-enter the rooms that have been closed...and they don't know when this might happen)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely unreliable, impolite staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ninetta2206
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hostel ever and I highly recommend NOT to go there. I initially booked a room in the Broadway Hotel and Hostel for my boyfriend and me as we were planning to go to a concert on a friday evening. When we arrived at the Broadway Hotel and Hostel we learnt that some rooms (including ours) had been closed as they needed some refurbishment! We have NOT been informed before our arrival about this neither did we get any compensation. Instead we had to take a taxi (of course we had to pay for it ourselves) to go to the sky hostel (where the Broadway hostel told us they reserved a room for us), Although I have asked for a compensation as well as proof of the cancellation for the room this has been refused. The staff was very impolite and the performance highly unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “love it”
Reviews.Author: kidnvega
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom stayed here in October 2009 and me and my best friend are coming back in January 2011, I was kind of skeptical because of the price but when we go there it was great,, suprisingly no bed bugs and I did not see any roaches but my mom reported to me that she saw one. overall very very pleased with trip. only thing I didnt like is that the bunk bed rooms were co-ed.

Reviews.Title: “Really good for the price”
Reviews.Author: emily201024
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at this hotel at the start of June, since then I have been meaning to write a review on how nice I thought the place was. We wanted to do New York on a budget and wanted a place to stay that was close enough to all the places we wanted to visit, this hostel was perfect for this. We got there and were meeted by helpful staff and were given our room key, we had the room with one queen size bed, the room was far better that I expected. We had everything we needed for the time we were there and the air conditioning and fan had alot of use cos of the hot weather. The bed was amazingly comfy especially after walking round New York for hours. I was personally worried about the bathroom, but on our floor the were 2 bathrooms, both with just one shower and toliet in so when you were in there it was just you, I have stayed in hostels before were its communal showers and I didnt like that. But hear it was fine, they were clean and nice to use. I was really impressed that a maid came and cleaned our room everyday, making the bed and taking out any rubbish, I honestly didnt expect this from a hostel, you could also see the bathrooms being cleaned on a daily basis. The reception area was nice with t.vs and computers, we paid $1.00 to use the computer everyday this was really helpful to check our money. On our first day we walked to the main part of Manhattan, this was quite a walk but we worked out how to use the subway and took that for the rest of our stay which saved us an hour a day in travel, the subway was 3 blocks up from the hostel and in 15 mintues we were at the subway in times square which was really handy for everything and it also took us straight to Battery Park for the Statue of Liberty. The only issue I had was the noise on a night, but our window did face the main street and it is New York. Plus I was too tired by the end of the day to notice. All in all this hostel was really good and well worth the money we paid, as there were no hidden or extra charges, what we were billed for is what we paid. I would highly recommend this hostel to anyone looking to go to New York and not spead loads on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service for a very reasonable price!!”
Reviews.Author: Mets0131
Reviews.Content: The date of our trip was actually April of 2009,,we came for the Mets Stadium opener.....We met Carl N at check in at the hostel and he was very upbeat, Kind and helpful in getting us all set for the night. Very helpful in the assisting of where to get trains, food and how things worked at the hostel..we would stay again if he was our host...Very good place for the value!! Thanks Carl! Charlie

Reviews.Title: “would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: livelaughl0ve85
Reviews.Content: Our first experience with this hostel wasn't great, but overall I think it's good value for money and in a great location. The first instance was when we arrived we were given a room on the second floor, opened the door, and it was a luggage storage room! I started to panick thinking they actually didn't have a room for us to stay in, but the receptionist's quickly sorted it out, no problem. We were then staying on the 5th floor. We were in a four bed dorm, right opposite the best bathroom on the floor, was perfectly acceptable. It seems to me that they are maybe trying to do a lot of work in making the hotel more up to date etc, because like I say the bathroom was perfect, all brand new etc. The room itself wasn't great, old tiling on the floor, radiator propped up with wood, bars on the window, but as your only using it as a place to sleep, doesn't really matter. The lift, yes it was slow, but we only used it when we were leaving with luggage. Wasn't impressed with one thing though. I'm pretty sure on one write up for the hotel there was mention of a kitchen. When we were there this wasn't the case, there was a mircowave, no cooking utensil's or cutlery or anything, so doesn't really qualify as a kitchen. They guy on the door, was very helpful and polite, always helped us with our bags, and arranged our taxi to the airport for us. Another plus was the 'Cheesy Pizza' across the road. We had take-away from there a couple of times, a good cheap pizza!! :) Overall I would definately stay again, as it was really close to the subway, a starbucks and quick cheap food. Good value I thought.

Reviews.Title: “Safe Place, Good Location , Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Jeab_BKK
Reviews.Content: New York Trip,2-10 July 2010 Broadway Hotel N Hostel This is such other nice place to sleep too. It is quiet and in a safe surrounding on the Broadway Rd.,West of Manhattan, it provides both of hotel and hostel style rooms. In fact I have booked a dorm for me and my friend but they arranged me a twin bed as in the pictures with no extra payment. Room is clean, Restroom outside is so nice with "Kohler". The hotel is just 5 min-walk from 103 St., subway station to reach the red line go directly downtown to Time Square, even the Statue of Liberty. However, it does not have breakfast including but there is a funtional kitchen for guests and there are some shops around to get some food. For more photos of Broadway Hotel N Hostel click at [---] One more thing I have to mention, a lift does not have space enough for 2 person with big luggages thus they must carried up and down stairs, however there is one man would help you this. My New York Trip Photos available at [---] Have a nice day, Chaniya Nurse from BKK

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay to visit New York”
Reviews.Author: MissLibelula
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in a quiet area and to walking distance to a subway station. There are supermarkets and restaurants near by. The staff at the reception were polite and helpful. The rooms were cleaned and ideal to rest after a long day discovering New York. Although we had to share bathroom with other guests, it was always cleaned and proper. In general, we had a good experince at this hotel. It is a pity the breakfast it's not included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff!”
Reviews.Author: VictorSwe
Reviews.Content: I've been to many hotels and hostels, during my travels. The Location of the hostel was good, it was easy to find, and I managed to get a shuttle bus straight there from the airport. And it was easy to get around the city using the subway. The rooms were nice, I stayed in a dorm type room, and it was pretty standard hostel type set up. Cleaner then a lot of dorms I've been. But what set this place apart from other hostels I've been to was the staff. They were really helpful. I had actually not really planned what I wanted to do during my visit to New York. So I talked to a girl in the reception named Angela who gave me a bunch of tips on what to do and marked them out on a map for me along with directions on how to get there. Also told me which days some of the museums had free admissions, which was really nice when I was traveling on a bit of a budget.

Reviews.Title: “don't expect too much..”
Reviews.Author: georgie891
Reviews.Content: Ok, on the pro side- it was a pretty good location- walking distance to Central Park, and there's a subway 2 streets away from the hostel, that stops at places like Penn Station, Times Square and South Ferry (where you get the ferry to Ellis Island) Unfortunately thats about all this place has going for it. The room I was in, was small to say the least, and basic. 2 bunk beds, no lockers and a sink.. thats it. It can also get quite hot in the small room, so I had to leave the airconditioning unit on almost the whole time, which is quite noisy. The bathrooms were ok, most of the time they were pretty clean, but some didn't have handsoap at the sink and none of them have showergel. Secondly- no breakfast, you can't even pay for breakfast- there is a small 'kitchenette' and a fridge where you can put your purchases, but thats it. If you have a laptop bring it, otherwise you're gonna be forking out .15cents a minute for the internet, and internet cafes are sparse in NYC. So overall, not great if you're looking for anything more than a bed (which I will say were very comfy and clean) but if you just want a place to sleep after a long day out, this will do.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - for New York - clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: MisterMooLondon
Reviews.Content: Paid $115 including tax for a double room with shared bathroom, which is as cheap as they come in Manhatten. Clean, reasonably secure and with friendly helpful staff. Only downsides were that the room was on the street and it had neither curtains (only blinds) and no double glazing, so by 6am the light was streaming in and the traffic was really noisy. We'd arrived off the plane at 2am and kickout time was 11am so that was rather a pity. $2 per bag for left luggage. Would recommend but get a room off the street!

Reviews.Title: “All the hotel perks for the price of a hostel. Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: JBHill
Reviews.Content: This hostel is great - only 2 blocks (3 minutes) walk south of the subway station (103rd st on red line - number 1) and very easy to find. Cheap chain supermarket near the subway and a great kitchen with grill/oven, toaster and microwaves - very easy to eat in. The mixed dorm 2 person hostel rooms are bunk beds with sink and air conditioner. Spacious room but basic. The 'shared bathroom' was great - actually a private bathroom but shared - so it had a toilet sink and bath/shower in the one room - better than the standard shower room ones you usually find in hostels. Nobody was ever using the bathroom when we wanted to so it was great. The hostel plays films throughout the day if you are having a lazy day and give out free popcorn. There are lots of comfortable lounge areas and big flat screens. I really loved this hostel! Don't hesitate to stay here! Be CAREFUL - although it is great that maids change your sheets daily - we are sure we had a metrocard stolen from our room - so don't leave anything worth stealing out.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been great except for bedbugs.”
Reviews.Author: IndyRedRosa
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were a bit surprised at the sparse room, just one set of bunk beds, sink, and two lockers, but had no complaints. The elevator was tiny and incredibly slow, but a necessity when staying on the sixth floor and carrying luggage. It was rather noisy and a bit stuffy, so having the air conditioner in the room helped solve both those problems. One of the bathrooms on our floor had been nicely updated, another had not and was rather dodgy. I saw a cockroach in one of them the first night we stayed, but none after. I did wake up after the second night with several bedbug bites, though my partner, sleeping on the top bunk, seems to have none. Security did not seem to be very good, as we came and went as we pleased, never questioned by staff; the rooms had one very simple deadbolt. I was very comfortable with the part of the city it's located in, nice neighborhood, close to the subway lines and plenty of places to eat nearby. Overall I'd recommend it to anyone, except for the bedbugs!!

Reviews.Title: “pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: i5405
Reviews.Content: Overall it was ok considering the price compared to other hotel/hostel. It was closed in the winter of 2009 as the city fined it for over-crowding but they have changed this now and limit 2 guests per room. Accomodations in New York are expensive so you have to compare what's available the time you go. My friend and I stayed in the 2 bed dorm room. We never stayed in a hostel before. We turned the air conditioner on at night to muffle the noise from doors slamming. Pro's- a)it's on the red subway line-if you get off on 96th you can take lines 1,2,3 (2 and 3 are express) b) there is only 2 guests per room in the dorm c) vanity in room Con's-a) pre-pay up front with cash or travellers cheques...no credit cards (technically you should be able to get a refund if you leave early however some posters complained they could not) b) one slow, small elevator c) kitchen facility is limited if you want to cook. d) there was no hot water to take a shower the first day we checked in at 3pm but the following 2 mornings there was hot water e) mattress is a narrow thin box-spring feel mattress (however it might be common for hostels as no one has mentioned this)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to start”
Reviews.Author: Anggelius
Reviews.Content: I were stay there travel with a lot of friends on the past winter, we get it there looking for the cheapest hostel on Manhattan, and I were spend a wonderful time in the hostal... they have all you need to discover NY, the subway is very near, also the central park, you will fund a lot of restorans in the neighborhood and you can meet a lot of diferent people there... and there is always a movie at the night, and something to do at night. Your money is well investment here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: the-amazing-grace
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Broadway Hotel & Hostel for just one night, and my overall impression was good. Its in a good location, had friendly staff and was clean. I had a private room with private bathroom, and although it was small, it was very pleasant. Downsides included the very slow elevator and the fact that the place was a bit too warm, especially the lounge area. Free wireless was good, but its only in the lounge. The $5 key deposit was a bit annoying, and so was the $2 per bag fee to store them, but none of these downsides detracted from the experience. I would more than likely stay again if I was looking for something reasonably priced in the Upper West side.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: cc5001
Reviews.Content: Even on first impression this place was dodgy.. there was a HUGE line at reception, people had all sorts of problems so we got to listen to that while we waited to check in. I don't think the staff were to blame but they hadn't been given much authority - their standard response was to see the Manager who 'wasn't in right now'. (Every time we came through reception it seem the manager was 'unavailable' even at times when he was scheduled to be there.) We eventually checked in and they told us that we'd have to change rooms part way through our 6 night stay as for some reason with 6 months notice they couldn't accommodate us. The one lift was reeeeeeally slow and barely big enough for the 3 of us and our luggage. Our room was basic but looked clean enough. However, 2 of us got bed bugs after night 1 (both top bunks) while our friend in the bottom bunk was fine. We left the next day without a refund. The lift was broken so we had to lug our bags down the stairs... We used the Internet there to book another hotel but half the machines were broken so we had to wait in line there too. The printer took your money but didn't print out anything and reception was unable to do anything without the Manager! This hotel is also apparently (as we were told by a local on our train into NY) above the imaginary line (which I think is around 85th St) where you shouldn't stay! Pluses: there was a nice Diner nearby... yeah that's all I can think of! The hotel isn't really near anything sightseeing-wise but it's not a huge walk to the Subway or shops, etc. Oh and on our first night we saw RATS on the footpath outside the hotel! I know it's NY but still...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Essdee86
Reviews.Content: Worst hostel I've ever stayed in. Firstly, we weren't told we had to pay cash upfront for 10 nights, which we didn't have on us. This was annoying but wouldn't really have been a big problem except that my friend had her laptop, passport and other valuables stolen from a LOCKED locker on the second day there and we couldn't get a refund when we wanted to leave; The staff were incredibley rude and very unhelpful from the start and even worse once my friend's belongings were stolen - they acted as though it was her fault (there were very obvious marks where her padlock had been cut off and it was mysteriously missing...); There were only two showers in our 'wing' to service far too many people (6 in our room and at least 4 other rooms on the floor), they did not drain, and I had a hot shower about 3 times out of the 10 days, even though we tried showering at different times of the day; The rooms weren't terrible but look absolutely nothing like the pictures - the lobby is fancy and modern but as soon as you take the first flight of stairs (or the dodgy elevator), it's a very run-down, dirty building; The lounge area looks nice but due to there being TVs in all the communal areas and peope glaring at you for talking to/planning things with friends, the place doesn't have a great atmosphere; Though a 'fully equipped kitchen' was listed when we booked, it is actually only 2 microwaves, a fridge and a small benchtop - a very expensive way to do things for a long stay. My list could go on and on but to sum up... DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for you buck! Location is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: boarderc4
Reviews.Content: The reception is a bit busy when checking in, but that is because this is a popular spot! In the lounge area they play movies all night and free wireless internet which was very useful. Most of the people staying seem to be from Europe. Everyone was very friendly and the rooms were clean. The bathrooms were also clean. The major thing I recommend is to get ear plugs. I would say this for any hostile you would stay at due to the roommates you would have. The major noise at this hostile was the heavy doors in the hallways slamming in the middle of the night. I quickly solved this problem with wax ear plugs that I bought at the local CVS. I stayed at another hostile for my last 2 nights in NYC and it was nice, but The Broadway Hotels location rules all. Lots of restaurants open on the street. The subway is very close. It is a very central location. I HIGHLY recommend staying here. I am someone who is VERY picky when it comes to cleanliness and the atmosphere is something I will never forget. The next time I visit NYC I will be staying here again! I

Reviews.Title: “not the place to be in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: schiemax
Reviews.Content: enough for sleeping in new york! and also cheap but nothing to stay for long time! a bit dirty! very old and rusty bathrooms. mice in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous to health”
Reviews.Author: Lolitocha
Reviews.Content: When I arrived in the hostel late in the evening tired after travelling for 10 hours, I was greeted with a note by the NYC council; on the Hostel front door saying "Warning this building is dangerous to health". Nice! You would think that the hostel would have contacted booked customers about this but no. They changed us to another hostel down the road, but this was ridiculous?!

Reviews.Title: “shut down”
Reviews.Author: carrocarola
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hostel they told us that it was shut down due to security problems. We could sleep there for one night and then we needed to find another hostel. They couldn't give us a good explanation for why it was shut down... We where 7 people and it was hard to find another hostel and the one that the broadway hostel recommended where full too. My recommendeation is to not stay here! They didn't call us or send an email that told us that it was shut down. We found out that when we got to the hostel at 9pm...

Reviews.Title: “Decent but cramped”
Reviews.Author: robso
Reviews.Content: Some rooms are newer & nicer than others - ours was full of beds which were incredibly squeaky. Two bathrooms per floor (about 6 bedrooms with 6 people sharing them) so gets dirty and long waits... Decent location but expected more for the price

Reviews.Title: “its big but no organised...”
Reviews.Author: bjornie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hostel for 3 nights and the hostel is first of all really big! Unfortunatly not enough staff, not organised at all, so if you wanna ask some information you dont get the right answer or you need to wait more then a halfanhour for the wrong answer. I had also problems with the keydeposit that they didnt wanna return, because I gave the key but didnt get the money.After I came back in the afternoon the staff was really unfriendly because of even they mad the mistake, try another hostel!!

Reviews.Title: “its a place to lay your head down, nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: cenfing80
Reviews.Content: The rates were great. The rooms and common areas were very clean. However, the bathrooms needed some attention. The walls are very thin, so you hear EVERYTHING. The exit doors leading to the hallway on each floor are very heavy, so when someone comes through it slams very loudly. The common areas were usually very congested. The staff was helpful, but not friendly. I would stay at this hostel again, but only if I HAD to.

Reviews.Title: “great for what you need”
Reviews.Author: greeneyes481
Reviews.Content: i was a bit concerned on arrival because of the amount of people that were in the reception area, but once we got checked in and taken to our 3bunk bed dorm it was fine, it was clean and ok for the money the beds were sweaky but your so tired you will sleep on anything, the location was brilliant and a short walk away are lots of eating places and the metro ,the lift is a bit dodgy my daughter and her friend got stuck one night and had to climb out, not the best thing to happen. Bathrooms are clean and usable, everything was great as we were only in there to sleep, after all it is new york the city that never sleeps, going there again next year, this time to a private room with my hubby cant wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Tati1120
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends stayed for a week.. The place was great. The staff is super friendly and always willing to help you find your way. There is always security up front, and there is always someone at the front desk. The rooms are cleaned every day.. fresh towels and sheets. Its obsiously not the W.. but its great for what you pay. If what you want is a cheap,clean, and safe play to stay I would definitely recommend this place. Great location too.. the Subway is only a couple blocks from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Irish Lad Who Loved This Pad!!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyJoJoShabbadoo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few hostels around the world and would rate Broadway up there with the best. For $30, all you can ask for is a comfortable bed, clean conditions and to feel safe. Broadway offers all of these. When you add the great location into the equation you know you've found a great little gem. There are 6-8 power showers on each floor with plenty of hot water. They also provide fresh sheets, pillows and towels every morning. Okay, so the staff can be a bit slow - but in a friendly way! If you are arriving late for check in, I would advise you contact the hostel ealrier in the day - especially if you want a private room with your friends. There is a small common area where you can watch a movie or use the internet. I wish they could put in a little bar (probably because I'm Irish) or even a coffee counter just to encourage a bit more interaction between guests! Having said this, there are some great diners around the corner and the hostel does organise a pub crawl twice a week. Everything considered, this is a great place to stay. Although it ticks all the 'C's - Clean, Cheap, Cheerful - I'd give it an A+.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: kelsie145
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I booked this place months in advance for a 4 bedroom private suite, when we arrived to drop off our luggage, we confirmed our check in and payed for our stay. We didn't arrive until around midnight to actually check in because we had been out site seeing all day in New York. When we tried to check in, they had "accidentally" given our room away even though we had already paid! All they could do was refund us our money. So, we were without a place to stay at midnight in New York! We had to walk several blocks in the middle of the night to find another place to stay which was very scary since we are all females! I would not recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Persephone83
Reviews.Content: I booked a private room for two nights and a room with two bunkbeds for another two so I've experienced both. There was a problem with the shower in the private room (no hot water) but housekeeping was able to fix it within fifteen minutes. Other than that the room was clean, large enough and came with airconditioning and a tv. The shower in (!) the room is all glass and the toilet semi see through so ye who enter here abandon all shame, or use the surprisingly clean and comfortable bathroom down the hall. There are three per wing per floor so they're seldomly all occupied and contain bath and/or shower, a toilet and a sink - you'll have it all to yourself. The elevator is small, slow, and seems to have a mind of its own so you're better off taking the stairs unless you're on the sixth floor. The staff is amazing. I was unlucky enough to share my bunkbed room with three noisy, smelly and scary guys so I asked whether I could book a private room instead in order to be able to get some sleep but they offered me another room, upgrading me to friendly and recently bathed roommates. The walls in this hotel are a little thin so if your neighbours happen to be on a romantic weekend you'll need some earplugs but hey, chances are you'll be out on the town. It's NYC after all. Be sure to ask them to book you the airlink shuttle to the airport. It's $20 so that will save you about $30- $40, depending on whether you're traveling to Newark or JFK.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a place!!”
Reviews.Author: kevyg
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I have now stayed here twice and would go again without a doubt. With the Subway one block away it is perfect for getting up in the morning, catching the sub, while grabbing a coffee on the way. I never had a bad nights sleep here. The lobby is great as are the staff. This hostel as everything one would need...internet access at good price, films every night/day and a nice clean kitchen. If your going to NYC, stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: thekennymeister
Reviews.Content: I was certainly a bit wary about booking this since hostels in NY can be very hit and miss, but having spent almost 2 weeks in the Broadway Hostel I can safely say I won't be staying anywhere else in Manhattan again. I'm not sure why the overall rating on tripadvisor is so low (maybe the hostel was done up recently) but I found it great value. The location is excellent - beside the main subway line (less than 10 mins into Time Sq) - and the hostel itself is very clean and comfortable. Bedding and towels are changed everyday and the bathrooms are also very well maintained. The staff are friendly and helpful (although checking in and out can take a while) and there is always security on the door to make sure only residents get in. The only thing I would fault the hostel on is that there is no real communal area (like a canteen) where people could have a drink and some food. There is a very comfortable area where you can watch tv and check the internet but this is quite small and doesn't really encourage interaction with the other guests. Aside from this small thing though it was perfect. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT!!! Definately somewhere we will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: smiler1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before going home after a summer in america and it is brilliant! the rooms are very spacious with a sink in each & clean bedding & towels are brought every day! there is an awesome communal room with setees & films on all the time.. free wifi... & a kitchen for anyone to use! the reception staff are so kind & help with directions if you need any!! they come out with some funny stuff too!! theres always a bouncer on the door who helps with any bags or luggage & when you check out there is a room to keep your bags in for cheap!! the hostel is only a 2 minute walk from 103rd street subway & there are loads of shops & restaurants nearby!!! we even walked to times square a couple of times & it only took an hour!! ohh & central park is a 10 minute walk too.. you can go watch some early sunday morning baseball practice haha!! if you want to stay somewhere for cheap.. with great people & loads of amenities close by then this hostel is definately the place to stay in new york!!

Reviews.Title: “Super !”
Reviews.Author: voyageureCanada
Reviews.Content: Great hostel, great location (2 street from subway 1-2-3). We appreciated the individual AC in each bedroom. Washrooms are clean, there is even a rain shower head ! Some hooks on the walls of the bedroom and maybe foam the reduce the noise of banging of the fire door at night would be greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hostel!”
Reviews.Author: Yogi_Bear_NZ
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in a 4 bed shared room. The bunks are creaky (but this is usually the case at hostels!) but for ~USD25 a night, its fantastic value as a cheap place to get some sleep. You dont go to NYC to stay in the hotel room!! Courteous and friendly staff, and good facilities. and most importantly, the toilets and showers were spotless. Has a good common room area with TV's, and is tastefully done. The people on here who complain about this place need to wake up and smell the roses!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: smilMaria
Reviews.Content: I can only recommend this Hostel. I was there with my two friends on vacation. We felt always safe and in very good hands!! There were hand on things and smiles and nice staff everyday. Especielly the doormen had a good humor and was so nice.! About the rooms, were there 4 bathrooms on the floor, so that worked very good! In the room was there a zink and a mirror and a stick to elctronik equipment. I would come back to this hostel next time I should go to NY. Everything is near, also the subway if you want to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in New York hostel”
Reviews.Author: Jose B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week enjoyed my stay good- clean.cheap for new York, good location close to subway, free Internet in lobby bad- no lockers in room and there are few in a corridor that are always in use, squeeky bunks, no mirrors in room

Reviews.Title: “OK just to sleep and shower”
Reviews.Author: reyesj226
Reviews.Content: We decided to drive to NYC from Maryland and were looking for a cheap hotel as close as possible to Times Square. So keeping in mind that we reserved this hotel the day before, I can't complain. One thing I learned while shopping around for a hotel, is that NYC hotels have 2 different kinds of rooms: Either you get your own private bathroom or have to use a shared bathroom. This means that you have to use a public bathroom for the entire floor! So when I called to book my room, I requested 2 rooms with 2 double beds in each room. Either I'm confused as to the meaning on double beds, or NY considers double beds to be twin beds! After checking in, we were waiting a while for the elevator. Since it was taking too long, we opted to take the stairs. Boy was that the worst thing I could have done! It just put a sour taste in my mouth for this hotel! The stairway halls were very narrow, dark, and dirty! I kept praying that I stranger wouldnâ€™t be waiting further up to rob me! I accidentally entered the wrong floor as the doors do not have a number to let you know which floor you are on. Boy what a mistake! I think I had entered the floor for people actually living here!
