It sort of reminded me of the hotel in the movie "Coming to America!" where it was filthy and had mice everywhere! (Not that I actually saw any-but can imagine just by the looks!) After hauling my luggage up to my room- I finally find the correct floor!! As I step into my room, I realize that itâ€™s not the rooms that I had booked. I look for a phone to call the lobby- but to my surprise- there were no phones in the room! Just my luck I didnâ€™t have the hotel number programmed to my cell phone, plus why would I have to waste my minutes calling them?!?! I turn right back around and have to go right back down the filthy stairs! By then I was aggravated that no one had offered to help me carry my luggage to the third floor, and that I had to go all the way back down to inform them of the mistake. I tell the receptionist that she made a mistake. I had requested 2 rooms with 2 double beds in each since there were 4 people staying in each room. She then proceeded to tell me that those were double beds! I think I would have let it go under different circumstances, but I took her attitude as â€œWell, youâ€™ve already paid- now youâ€™re screwed!â€� I asked if we can get 2 additional rooms at a discounted price then and they were not very accommodating! But she did offer to provide extra blankets and pillows for someone to sleep on the floor!! (Isnâ€™t that against fire code policy??) We ended up staying there since I didnâ€™t want the hassle of looking for another hotel on such short notice and the majority that I had previously looked up were already booked. We only needed the room to sleep and shower- and they did their purpose. In regards to the shower- either you need to get up extra early or wait until very late at night to take your shower as the hot water is very scarce here! All in All- it all just goes back to the saying â€œYou get what you pay for!â€� But I was just so aggravated that the pictures on their website made it seem like they were such a nicer hotel! I felt really bad with my extended family for choosing this hotel! So the big question is â€“ would I stay there again? Definitely not! Next time I will definitely pay the extra bucks to stay in a cleaner hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Maria59066
Reviews.Content: The hostel was in a great location, walking distance to Central Park, great cheap restaurants close by. The staff were very accommodating and helpful. The had good amenities, and free movies in the common room every night.

Reviews.Title: “awesome, well worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: happy-sydney09
Reviews.Content: I stayed almost 3 weeks at the hostel in a 4 bed dorm. The staff were more than helpful, i always felt completely safe, especially since this was the first coed hostel i was staying in. The room was cold and the hot water not always working, however the bed was clean!!! that was a major factor in staying at this hostel. Yeah there are renovations but it just shows that the hotel is trying to make itself even better than it is. Definately recommend this hotel to anyone, including my grandparents and will be returning November 2009 for yet another wonderful stay. There is a common room - which always showed movies, very friendly atmosphere, location is far from most things but your in NY to sight see so walking everywhere is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Use the Luggage Check!”
Reviews.Author: rippedf
Reviews.Content: I am still waiting for a response to my review which is no longer posted. I checked my bag which contained text books and personal items; I handed it to an employee and that is the last time I saw it. It was a lap top bag although for me it contained expensive text books that I needed for my classes. No one was helpful when I tried to pick it up. I tried multiple calls once I returned to Minnesota, I faxed the requested form, Jeremy never got back to me. This left a very negative impression and caused a lot of hassles and expense to replace the stolen items.

Reviews.Title: “maybe keep looking for something better”
Reviews.Author: trekking09
Reviews.Content: This is really not like a hostel as my husband and I know them...there is no common room and the kitchen is basically non-existent, which was very disappointing as this was one of the main ways we hoped to save $ in the expensive city of NY. There is only one fridge which ws always packed solid and hot water and access to showers was limited. Staff were ok, not overly friendly or interested in their customers. A suggestion to the establishment: at least put some decent curtains or blinds in rooms so you are not woken early by the first bit of light, some travellers have travelled far and need a good sleep, no matter if it is morning. Maybe you could find something better??

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hostel”
Reviews.Author: kochampiwo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in the middle of May, 2009. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful, at all hours of the day and night! The washrooms were very clean, though as in many hostels I've stayed at, on some days there was no hot water past 10am. We stayed in a 4 person room with (very basic) bunk beds (room 223). The room was rather gloomy and must have been located near a kitchen vent or something because there was a constant smell of cooking grease present (this provided us with a core inside joke of our trip, 'the french fry room'). The setup of the hostel was not very conducive to meeting other people and hanging out. There was an area with chairs and a few TVs and a bunch of computers for (paid) internet surfing, but nothing in the way of a place where you could have a drink with people and mingle. The location was great with a great food place across the street (Broadway Bagel). Tons of options to choose from for every meal. We definitely enjoyed that. The hostel was also 2 blocks from a subway stop. It was a bit of a ride to places like Soho, but the lower price of the hostel was worth it. Overall, it provided what we would expect from a hostel. It could improve on a couple of things like a bar or better lounge area, free internet, and the closing of french fry rooms :P Still, it was clean and in a good location. Recommended! P.S. there is a parking garage just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: popdesign
Reviews.Content: I've been there for 9 nights and it was ok. There are lots of people complaining about the pictures, but there are lots of places that the pictures are even better than the real place. I stayed at the hostel part at a room with 4 beds and I was luck of having friendly roommates. The bathrooms at my floor were clean almost all the time and the linen and towels were changed everyday. The location is fine, close to places for eating and a small walking distance for the 103st station. The only thing that I didn't like was the wifi connection, because you have to go to the lobby with the laptop, I think that for the future the staff should install some routers at the other floors... And the wifi signal was very poor, the connection failed lots of times... it was a little bit desapointing. But if I come back to NY I will consider that place. It was fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “I live around the corner. I have put my family members at the Broadway For Years”
Reviews.Author: wileyveteran
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there on occasion as well. I trust this Hostel for my family and loved ones. Since I live in a very small apartment, I need to have a great place for my extended family to stay when they come to visit - it seems there is always someone from my family at the Broadway. It is very clean, the staff headed by the Manager, Jeremy, are excellent. I will continue to have my family stay there, in fact as I remodel my apartment, I will be ther too next month.

Reviews.Title: “Appearances are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Mischief07
Reviews.Content: The location of this hostel/hotel was good, and easy to find. Also the linens and towels in the rooms were changed daily which was great. I was made to wait when I checked in as the reception staff were having a personal conversation, and despite seeing me waiting, did not put their customer first. I found this odd especially as Americans are renowned for their supposedly excellent customer service. The door on my room was broken, the door handle actually fell off every time someone touched it. I reported this to reception and was assured it would be dealt with immediately, however it was still broken when I left. There are no lockers either in the rooms or anywhere else so the fact that the door was broken was a big security issue for me. Not entirely sure why they have people on the door when they don't help with luggage, open doors, or check IDs of guests. When booking on the Hostelworld website, it clearly states that every guest will receive "complimentary amenities upon Check-In for all guests including brand name products - Razors, Tooth Brushes And Paste And Feminine Products". This is stated on other booking sites also. I didn't receive this, and while it's not a deciding factor as to whether to book here or not, if it is stated then it should obviously be supplied. If they were not available then this should hae been explained. There were only 3 shared bathrooms on my floor, I never found it to be a problem for queues but could see how it might be. The shower I used was incredible and impressive, a huge shower fitted to the ceiling so the water fell like a waterfall. The lobby area was always crowded but visually very elegant. I didn't expect the photos on the website to match to what was actually there, but the lobby and common room area photos were accurate, it's a shame the actual reality of staying here (and not just for me judging by the rest of these reviews) couldn't live up to the initial appearance of the place.

Reviews.Title: “An experience-THE ADVERTISED PICTURE IS NOT WHAT YOU GET! I WONDER IF IT EXISTS!”
Reviews.Author: shoooee
Reviews.Content: Ok, Firstly I would like to point out i'm not fussy when it comes to accomodation being a student and all that. We were travelling in a group of Three and the Two other girls had reservations about staying in a hostel. After much persuasion we booked the Broadway hostel for three nights. 1.We booked out a 4 bed dormitory and paid for an extra person in order to have a bit of privacy. 2 Upon arrival we checked in the receptionist was quite busy but really nice.However the lift was broken and we had to haul suitcases up a tiny staircase which was hell especially if you were on the top floor, plus we had luggage for a Four month stay in America. Noone even bothered asking if we wanted help and actually complained because we carried the suitcases up the stairs and therefore took over the staircase. 3. upon entering the room there was a male in our room even though we had paid for the room for 4 people. 4. The showers were freezing but sure I hopped in anyway. Overall the security team is great, really nice and so helpful and you felt safe that they were there all night. The housekeepers are fantastic! The above would be expected when the room rates WERE as cheap as $18 however I have just looked up the prices and see that they have changed and are very expensive now so in my opinion they should drop there prices as they are ridiculously overpriced.We never complained about our stay! The one thing I feel strongly about is false advertisment as the room that is advertised in the picture is not what you get AT ALL! I wonder if this room actually exists!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places out there”
Reviews.Author: borninMN
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at how cheap the place was - approx. $18 a night for a four-bed dormitory room. However, I soon realized why it was so cheap after my first night there. The showers were always cold, and the room temperature was unstable. My first few nights were freezing cold, and my last night was extremely hot. The pictures are very deceiving. The walls are thin, so you can hear everything going on outside - including toilets flushing from down the hall. On their Web site, their security policy says that they check the IDs of everyone that comes through the door. This is absolutely false, and it is why someone who wasn't even staying at the hostel was able to follow me to my room and showed up there the next night. I checked out a week and a half early because I was so fed up with my stay. On the plus side, the staff was very nice and understanding. The movies in the lobby were cool (although a little loud) and it was nice that they had a little kitchenette in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “We Looooove New York!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: emandgeorge
Reviews.Content: We are writing this review mainly because when we were trying to find out info about this hotel we could only find reviews for the hostel part. We found this hotel/hostel absolutely perfect for the purpose of it. We spent very little time here as we was mainly out touring the massive New York City! We were staying here for a week and it wasnt until the end of the week that we had seen all we wanted to and shopped and walked miles that we stayed in the room a bit longer. It is value for money (would of been better if the pound stayed strong against the dollar but oh well), in a good area( Mama Mexico restaurant was a favourite of the week and over the road from the hotel and great takeout pizzas too after the tavern! Bonus) and cleaned every day with fresh towels. It had friendly staff and had no problems with checking in or the lift what everyone seems to moan about. And downstairs which we only found only the last day was a great shared area with tv's which they show films and a great looking kitchen. Also its on 101st and there is a subway at 103rd so very handy once you master them. Overall we were both very pleased are only bad point was a very noisy bed! Lol! Dont expect the ritz but it is all you need but i can only speak for the hotel not the hostel which may be very different but you get what you pay for and this was quality for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best. Not the worst.”
Reviews.Author: JustineK
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 bed dorm for 5 nights stay for myself, (35) my sister (33) and my Mum(61). I figured that paying a little extra would mean we would have more space and more privacy. This turned out to be a top idea. We had to move rooms after two nights to ensure we had the 4 bed dorm to ourselves but it was no drama. We just stored our luggage in the locked stoage room during the day and checked back in that night. I was a little hesitant about staying in a hostel with a bunch of backpackers, especially with Mum with us but it was fine. There was quite a bit of noise in the hallways at night and from the other dorms - just chatter and laughter, but the blue 'extreme' noise reduction earplugs from Hearos soon put an end to that! The first room window didn't open but the second one did which was great for some fresh air, although the street noise from Broadway meant we couldn't leave it open all night. There are only 3 bathroom/restrooms in each tower/floor which meant lining up. These are in the process of being renovated and were very nice and clean considering how many people were using them. I'd suggest they install a few just 'toilet' rooms on each floor, so if you are busting to go in the morning, you don't have to wait for the person to finish in the shower first. I second the suggestion that they introduced single-sex dorms. Although this wasn't an issue for me this time, I would have hated it if I had to share with a bunch of blokes if I was travelling alone. The smell of mens dirty socks would have driven me out into the street! The elevator is ancient and tiny, so taking the stairs was often quicker, especially on the way down. But this is New York, whaddya expect? The foyer area is very modern and boutique style which is nice, but doesn't really reflect the rest of the accomodation. It also gets very crowded especially after 3pm when everyone is trying to check in. Staff were pretty good, especially Brendan who went out of his way to help us. There's cheap internet access computers in the common area and free wi-fi available. The location is pretty good. About a 8 minute walk to the 103rd st subway station on the #1 line. The neighbourhood is fairly residential although there are lots of places to eat and drink near by. It's not in the tourist-trap area of Times Square, so it's mostly locals and independent travellers in the area. I can highly recommend the mushroom and swiss cheese omlette at the French cafe on Broadway towards 103rd. Soleil something. Just get there before 9am for the breakfast special prices! The Metro Diner on Broadway is also good for fast and furious NYC food. Try the gigantic spagetti and meatballs - in fact share them with a friend! There's a laudromat around the corner as well as a pharmacy/drugstore. I'd stay at the Broadway hotel again and would recommend it to all who aren't too precious about their hotel accomodation. On this trip I stayed at all types including a 5* star hotel. I'm there to experience the city and culture - not worry too much about the thread count of the sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to YMCA”
Reviews.Author: trcres
Reviews.Content: I had a difficult time finding a private room during the New York marathon, and stumbled upon the Broadway Hotel and Hostel. The people at the service desk were great, and the accommodations were fine. The room was small (6 x 12) a bunk bed, a small table, but no dresser or closet for clothes. There were four bathrooms on the floor (we stayed on the 2nd floor) and each had its own toilet, sink and shower, so we had privacy. The bathrooms were very clean. We had to run the fan at night as the noise in the hall was loud, and the heater didn't work, so we got more blankets. Linen and towels changed daily. No phone or TV. Lobby area spacious and clean. Computers available. Location: From La Guardia take the M60 bus to the last stop at 106th street and Broadway and walk to hotel. Subways: the 1 stops at 103rd Street, but the 2 & 3 express subways stop at 96th Street and it's worth walking a few more blocks to avoid the local 1. Note well: only cash or travelers checks are accepted. Our four day stay for two people was $450.00.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely pay more for the private rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mphetamin
Reviews.Content: NYC is like London: expensive overpriced lodging, most of which have misleading professional photos of the actual rooms. However, if you can afford to spend ~ $65 dollars/night, definitely go for the private ensuite double rooms. THESE are the red-walled rooms advertised on their website with dark wood furniture. We had a nice double bed with clean sheets (and no bedbugs!) + a small ensuite shower --> a huge blessing that we did not have to share bathrooms with other people who leave it really dirty! Did not see the dorm areas so cannot confirm the tatty carpets and shabby rooms (unlike the advertised pictures).

Reviews.Title: “doesn't live up to boutique image on website”
Reviews.Author: Fii
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the broadway Hotel n Hostel on a recent trip to New York with friends. we chose this place cos we wanted a hostel to save money, but this one stood out from the rest as it looked like it would be just that little bit more comfortable, with more ammenities due to the fact it was also a hotel. Bearing in mind we planned to stay in a hostel, it had everything we needed, but wasn't worth the extra money we'd paid expecting a more up market hostel, as it had nothing to back that up. The lobby area is lovely, really modernly presented, but as soon as you go up the stairs to your room, the carpet seems to run out as soon as you turn the corner from reception, and the great presentation of reception, is no more. this would be fine if it wasn't for the fact that the website makes the hostel appear to be more than it actually is. Our dorm was an 8 bed, and was pleasent enough, very basic which is what you'd expect from a hostel, but not what you'd expect from what the website shows!!! on our floor there were 3 bathrooms, between about 7/8 rooms (i'm not sure if they were all 8 bed though) which can be a hassle in the mornings with everyone trying to shower. also each bathroom is a shower, toilet and basin, there are no seperate toilets, which when everyone's showerring can me crossing your legs. we had the added problem on our floor that one of the bathrooms didn't have a lock, luckilly i have good friends though, so we'd read a magazine in the corridor while th others showered to avoid having to wait for one of the 2 working bathrooms. the only other downside would be that the staff aren't particularly helpful, they just didn;t seem that switched on. The doorman was lovely, but the actual reception staff were a little useless, they alwys said they's help with whatever you asked, but never seemed to deliver. from the moment we arrived we were asking for extra blamkets as the room got a little cold at night, they were always in the wash and would be brought to us in 10 minutes. the first 10 minutes lasted 3 days, we finally managed to get our extra blankets on our last night!!! all in all, i wouldn't say don't stay here, but i would say, don't go with the high expectations you may get from the fancy website.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: Dorisone47
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the four people dorm 7 nights, checking in was really quick. The lobby was looking good, it was safe, I didn't loose anything. It gives you the opportunity to meet people since there are a lot of young people staying there. The room was very small though and the flooring was all torn out. The restrooms were clean, and the room were also clean. They did the beds every day. It was with easy access to downtown. A lot of places where to eat in the area. Facing Broadway street, great location. Security man who opens the door for you each time you enter or go out. The rooms are mixed between man and women which might be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bit of NYC”
Reviews.Author: oz2u
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 6 bunk share room for the first night and a private ensuite for the following 9 nights. I didn't like the share room, as there is no luggage storage in the room, and if you dont have locks on your bags, then you better hope there is nothing valuable in them! The share bathrooms were clean enough considering how many people were using them! The private ensuite was great and at US$100 a night, you can't really complain!! It was clean, the sheets and towels changed daily, had fully functioning AC and TV. No issues. The only things I didn't like were the slow lift, MUCH faster, though a pain as we were on level 4, to take the stairs! Reception. Check in was slow and a painful process. The girl there must have been training, but was just so unnapproachable! Luckily there was a guy there who seemed to be the manager who took over and looked after our booking. All in all, I thought it was in a great location, was safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirl1983
Reviews.Content: While the hostel is not as flash as it appears in the website photos, it is a pretty nice place for price. I found it to be very clean and the rooms were roomy enough, freshly painted, A/C, basin, mirror. There were 4 clean bathrooms on our floor, just don't plan to shower (or pee!) at peak times. The lounge/kitchen is a great place to meet other travellers and you are allowed to bring alcohol in, with plasma screens showing movies. Bank of computers with internet at a decent speed/price. The elevator is sooo slow, take the stairs. Lots of shops, restaurants, cafes, laudromat etc close by and seemed like a decent neighboorhood. Short stroll to the subway station, longer walk to Central Park. My only criticism is that the rooms are all co-ed. It was fine most of the time, because I was travelling in a mixed group, but one girl had booked separately and was put in a mixed dorm - a little intimidating for a young female traveller. I'm going back to New York and am staying at a different hostel purely because of this reason, if I was not travelling alone or they introduced single-sex dorms, I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “you'll love it, if you like mice !”
Reviews.Author: grigra
Reviews.Content: the lobby looks very nice but the rooms of the hostel look very different. i thought it's a very nice hostel until we heard some strange noise at night. we had mice in our room and so we asked for a different room. we immediatly got one - that was great - but in the other room we had also mice !! we were so tired, that we just closed the hole where they seemed to come out and at the next morning we had to change room because it was overbooked. so it was very exhausting at this hostel : ( the good things were the elevator, free wlan and every day some nice movies at the tv-room and on weekends with popcorn : ) the bathrooms and the position of the hostel were okay too. although there were some good things at this hostel i wouldn't recommend it because the fact of the mice overweight everything. it's a great pity : (

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable, probably even illegal”
Reviews.Author: HostelNightmare
Reviews.Content: My friends stayed at this hostel. They left their valuables in the locks. These locks were opened by thiefs and everything was taken, passports and cameras and everything. And this is a hostel deemed "safe" that has a security guard on duty! My friends tried to retrieve the copy of their passports that had been taken by the hostel staff, but these copies had mysteriously disappeared. The hostel offered no help (other than a free night, valued at what? 50 bucks?), no apologies. My friends were left out in the city with nothing. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: MangoFinland
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my friend for only 3 nights, instead of 6. We had our beds in a dorm for 6 persons but as the guy in the reception gave us only one key they eventually "overbooked" our room and for short time there was 7 people staying in the same dorm. The staff there is rude and it takes a long time to check in to the hostel! The elevator doesn't work properly and the stairs are a nightmear especially if you have luggages. The rooms are small (what you can expect to have in a budget hostel) and the bunk beds are very shaky and you don't want to sleep on the upper bed. The bathrooms are disgusting. Although they are cleaned once a day, they get quickly very dirty and damp - the water stays on the floor with lots of hair... There were three (or four) bathrooms on the same floor, all in the same condition. Must have been the worst hostel ever. The only good things are that the location is ok and we felt pretty safe there.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: cheerleader_girl
Reviews.Content: this was definatly the worst hostel we stayed at in our trip round america. When we arrived there it took over an hour to check in, we then had to carry our bags up seven flights of steps because the lift was broken; only to find somebody else in our assigned room. It then took them another couple of hours to sort out this mistake in which time we realised that the hot water had broken, and it wasnt fixed for another two days. The beds were also very uncomfortable, seeming to consist mainly of very large springs. When the lift did start working, we were unable to use it as it was ridiculoulsly small and very slow and seemed in danger of breaking at any moment. However the rooms were cleaned every day, the location was good and there was hardly any street noise and most of the staff were very nice, however when we asked them to get us a taxi for the airport they called a private firm who charged us much more than a taxi would have. The downstairs of the hotel was lovely, sadly the rooms in no way matched the standard of the lounge areas. The free film screenings everynight were excellent however. It wasnt appalling but i definatly wouldnt visit again.
